description: Daily absence rate exactly 100% (at MINOR threshold)
Monthly absence rate exactly 20% (at MAJOR threshold)
Annual absence rate exactly 20% (lower CRITICAL boundary)
Annual absence rate exactly 30% (extreme CRITICAL boundary)
Politician with 80% annual absence rate
Politician with 5% absence rate (normal attendance)
Summer recess absence (25% in June-August)
notes: Summer recess should be excluded from detection

description: Strategic absence on controversial votes only (15% targeted)
notes: Selective absence may mask as acceptable rate

description: Rebel rate exactly 5% (at MINOR threshold)
Rebel rate exactly 10% (at MAJOR threshold)
Rebel rate exactly 20% (at CRITICAL threshold)
Consistent rebel voting at 25% across all issue types
notes: High rebel rate indicates party crisis

description: Loyal party member with 2% rebel rate
notes: High party discipline should NOT trigger

description: Coalition negotiation period rebel votes (8% during formation)
notes: Coalition formation rebel votes may be strategic

description: Principled dissent on specific issues (12% issue-specific)
notes: Ideological consistency may mask as disloyalty

description: Exactly 5 documents last year (at MINOR threshold)
Exactly 0 documents last year (at MAJOR threshold)
Average 3 docs/year over 2+ years (at CRITICAL threshold)
New politician with zero documents in first year
Active legislator with 20 documents/year
Minister with 3 documents (focused on government work)
Committee chair with 4 documents (leadership not measured)
notes: Leadership work may not appear in document counts

description: Attendance drop 15% + productivity decline 20% (pre-resignation pattern)
Monthly absence >10% worse than annual baseline
Stable performance across monthly and annual metrics
Temporary absence due to illness (recovers next month)
notes: Temporary health issues should not be detected as decline

description: Gradual decline over 6 months (below monthly threshold)
notes: Slow decline may stay below detection threshold

description: Party with exactly 20% absence rate (MAJOR threshold)
Opposition party with 35% absence during boycott
Government party with 8% absence rate
notes: Normal party attendance should NOT trigger

description: Summer recess absence (30% in July-August)
Selective absence on controversial votes (18% targeted)
notes: Strategic absence may mask as acceptable

description: Party declining from 45% to 25% win rate over 3 months
Stable party performance across quarters
Opposition party win rate drop (structural not behavioral)
notes: Opposition parties naturally have lower win rates

description: Gradual decline over 12 months (below quarterly threshold)
notes: Slow decline may stay below detection threshold

description: Committee with exactly 5 documents/year (MINOR threshold)
Committee with zero documents in 6 months
Active committee with 50 documents/year
Specialized committee with 8 documents (quality over quantity)
notes: Specialized committees may produce fewer but higher-impact documents

description: Committee with 6 documents (just above threshold but declining)
notes: Just above threshold masks declining productivity

description: Ministry with exactly 10 documents/year (MAJOR threshold)
Ministry with zero legislative initiatives in 6 months
notes: Zero output signals government implementation failure

description: Productive ministry with 100 documents/year
New ministry in first quarter (12 documents in 3 months)
Ministry with 11 documents (just above threshold but declining)
notes: Just above threshold masks declining effectiveness

description: Party with exactly 30% approval rate for 3 months (at MODERATE threshold)
Party with 28% approval for 2 months then 32% (intermittent)
Opposition party with 18% approval for 6 months
Government party with 65% approval rate
Coalition party with 25% approval during policy negotiation
notes: Temporary low approval during coalition talks may be strategic

description: Party with 31% approval for 3 months (just above threshold)
notes: Just above threshold masks legislative ineffectiveness

description: Politician with exactly 20% approval on 10 proposals (at MINOR threshold)
Politician with 19% approval on 15 proposals (below threshold)
Politician with 8% approval on 20 proposals
notes: Very low approval indicates legislative failure

description: Effective politician with 75% approval on 25 proposals
Opposition politician with 18% approval (structural)
notes: Opposition members naturally have lower approval rates

description: Politician with 21% approval on 9 proposals (insufficient sample)
notes: Requires minimum 10 proposals for statistical significance

description: Ministry declining exactly 20 percentage points QoQ (at MAJOR threshold)
Ministry declining 30 percentage points QoQ (CRITICAL)
Ministry declining from 70% to 35% approval QoQ
Stable ministry maintaining 80% approval rate
New minister's first quarter adjustment (from 55% to 40%)
notes: Initial transition period may show decline

description: Ministry declining 18 percentage points (just below threshold)
notes: Just below threshold masks significant decline

description: Daily decisions exactly 2 std dev above mean (z-score = 2)
Daily decisions exactly 2 std dev below mean (z-score = -2)
Crisis legislation surge: z-score = 3.5 (100 decisions in 1 day)
Parliamentary paralysis: z-score = -3 (0 decisions in 1 day)
Normal decision volume within 1 std dev of mean
Pre-recess surge: z-score = 2.5 (expected anomaly)
Gradually declining volume over 3 months (each day normal)
notes: Slow decline may not trigger daily anomaly detection

description: Coalition alignment exactly 60% over 30 days (at threshold)
Coalition alignment 58% (just below threshold)
Coalition partners with 35% alignment (severe misalignment)
Strong coalition with 85% alignment
Coalition alignment 55% during budget negotiation (temporary)
notes: Temporary misalignment during major negotiations may be normal

description: Declining alignment from 75% to 62% over 6 months (slow deterioration)
notes: Gradual decline may stay just above threshold while signaling trouble
